thread.section_title: Steelers sign tight end Ryan Malleck to futures contract | Steelers Wire
thread.title: Steelers sign tight end Ryan Malleck to futures contract
thread.title_full: Steelers sign tight end Ryan Malleck to futures contract

author: Simon A Chester
title: Steelers sign tight end Ryan Malleck to futures contract
text:
The Pittsburgh Steelers completed another futures signing on Wednesday with the addition of tight end Ryan Malleck, a move the team announced via their Twitter account.
We have signed TE Ryan Malleck.
— Pittsburgh Steelers (@steelers) February 22, 2017 
Hailing from Virginia Tech, Malleck spent time with the Giants in 2016 after signing with New York as an undrafted free agent. Despite standing out early on in training camp, Malleck was ultimately waived injured at the end of August after suffering a neck injury during practice. He would go on to receive an injury settlement a few weeks later.
The Steelers had shown some interest in the former Hokie themselves when they sent tight ends coach James Daniel to his Pro Day last March, a day in which he apparently performed quite well.
#Hokies Tweets: Lots of scouts keeping their eyes on TE Ryan Malleck. #ProDay2016 pic.twitter.com/tTrxabVi6c https://t.co/RIFv1dJ70Y 
— Hokies Herald (@hokiesherald) March 16, 2016 
TE Ryan Malleck running routes. #Hokies pic.twitter.com/rnWkrLmnAs 
— Andy Bitter (@AndyBitterVT) March 16, 2016 
Like all futures signings, Malleck will have signed a one-year deal worth $465,000. Although he joins a roster with a limited number of tight ends signed to the roster currently, Malleck will face an uphill battle to find a spot among the final 53. A place on the practice squad for 2017 could be a possibility.
Related: It appears Le'Veon Bell won't have surgery on injured groin
